<h2> ğŸ›  Option 1: Contributing via VS Code (Git-Based Workflow) </h2>

1ï¸âƒ£ Fork the Repository <br>

2ï¸âƒ£ Clone Your Fork <br>

```bash

```
Replace YOUR-USERNAME with your GitHub username. <br>

3ï¸âƒ£ Open the Project in VS Code <br>

4ï¸âƒ£ Create a New Branch <br>

```bash

```
Replace feature-name with a short description of your change (e.g., fix-navbar animation or listings, add-dark-mode).
<br>
5ï¸âƒ£ Make Your Changes <br>

6ï¸âƒ£ Commit Your Changes <br>


7ï¸âƒ£ Push to Your Fork <br>
```bash

```

8ï¸âƒ£ Submit a Pull Request (PR) <br>
- Go to your forked repository on GitHub. <br>

- Fill in details about your changes. <br>
- Click Submit pull request. <br>
`ğŸ‰ Thatâ€™s it! Now, wait for review and feedback.`
